column1: Do you have s second?
column2: Sure. What do you want?
column3: I want to tell you I've put in my notice.
column4: Really? Why?
column5: I've been thinking about this for several months, well before the Spring Festival holidays.
column6: And the holidays provided you a chance to think over all this and make a decision?
column7: Yeah, after receiving my yearly bouns, I want to search out better opportunities in the spring job market. I've been working in the company for nearly a year and a half and I still haven't received a pay rise. It's unfair.
column8: Absolutely. With your expertise and experience, you're clearly working below your pay grade.
column9: That's exactly why I decided to quit the job and find a new one.

column1: Ah! No! Damn it!
column2: It's a blackout. Now I can't see Seinfeld.
column3: So what? I just lost one hour's worth of work.
column4: Really? How could you do that? Don't you save every couple minutes?
column5: No, I didn't save this time.Damn it! And I'm sick of writing this paper. Now I have to write it all over again too.
column6: I've had that problem too many times. So I learned to save.When I'm writing something, I save every three sentences or so. I don't want to lose anything.
column7: I hate computers. Sometimes I think they cause more trouble than they're worth.
column8: What are we going to do now?
column9: I don't know. I feel like going out.
column10: I wonder how much of the city is down.
column11: It doesn't matter. I still can go out and buy a beer.
column12: Maybe. But if there's a blackout, probably the pubs are closed.And besides, I know you have a political science exam tomorrow. I thought you had a lot of reading to do.
column13: Yes, that's true. Damn! I just lost half my paper, and now I can't even do my homework.This is a bad time for this to happen.
column14: I have a flashlight in my closet. If you want to use that to read, you can.
column15: Thanks. I think I will try. Where are you going?
column16: I like your idea of getting a beer. I think I'll go out myself.
column17: Maybe we can trade.Why don't you stay here and read for my exam, and I'll go drink beer?
column18: No, it just won't work.If I read for your exam, you won't know the answers tomorrow. I will.
column19: So? You can go to the class for me.Just write my name on the exam book and take the exam. Why not?
column20: How many students are in the class?
column22: So it won't work, old buddy. They'll see that I'm not you. Sorry.

column1: Hello, sir. Have you anything to declare?

column7: How many bottles have you got with you?
column8: Four bottles.
column9: I'm sorry. According to the regulations, a passenger can only take two bottles on to the aircraft. So you cannot take so many.
column10: What shall I do with my two more bottles?
column11: You may give them to your friends who come to see you off. This is the Customs Declaration Form. Please fill in it. And then you can go through the other formalities. Be sure to keep the form safe.
column12: All right, thank you, see you.
column13: See you. Have a good journey.

column1: I can ’ t believe my English teacher is making me read pride and prejudice!
column2: Why not! It ’ s a classic ; in fact, it ’ s one of my favorite novels.
column3: But it ’ s so old.
column4: Don ’ t judge a book by its cover. Do you Kwon what it ’ s about?
column5: No, not at all.
column6: First of all, it ’ s a romance novel, set in the early 19th century.
column7: I didn ’ t realize it was a romance novel. What ’ s the main storyline?
column8: It ’ s basically about a father who tried to marry off one of his five girls.
column9: Why does he want to do that?
column10: Since he doesn ’ t have a son, he hopes that one of the girls will marry a wealthy man. That way, all of his daughters will be cared for.
column11: Won ’ t they get his inheritance?
column12: No, that ’ s the problem. Though they are well-off, once he dies, his house will go to his cousin. So, when he dies, the girls will have nothing.
column13: I see. This sounds interesting! Maybe my teacher isn ’ t so horrible after all.
column14: So, are you going to read the novel or watch the movie?
column15: There ’ s movie? My teacher didn ’ t tell me that!
column16: That ’ s probably because she wants you to read the book first.
column17: It would take a lot less time..
column18: How about this. When you finish the book. I ’ ll get the movie and watch it with you.
column19: Ok. That sounds like a deal.

column6: Well, the minister at my church told us about it, and it seemed interesting. I thought I'd try it once, and if I didn't like it I'd stop.
column7: So what do you do there?
column8: It's simple. All we do is prepare some food, usually sandwiches and some fruit, and give it out to them at the soup kitchen.
column9: Yeah, it sounds easy. How long does it take?

column11: I don't know. I mean, I like helping the community and all that, but I don't know if I have the time...
column12: Come on, it's easy, and it'll make you feel good. Why don't you come with me tonight?

column1: How is everything going with your girlfriend?

column3: Oh, I am sorry to hear that. I did't know that you had split up. What happened?
column4: It was a few things. The first thing that happened was that we were supposed to go out for a romantic dinner for our one year anniversary, but she stood me up!
column5: Really! Did she tell you why she didn't show up?
column6: No, but I ended up finding out later that night when I saw her drinking with another man at a club near my home!
column7: What was she thinking? Did you confront her about it when you saw her?
column8: I wanted to, but I knew that if I spoke to her, I'd just blow up at her, so I decided to just go home. I called her later that the night, but she didn't answer the phone.
column9: I can't believe she would do that to you. It's so dishonest-and rude!
column10: I know. I still haven't heard from her. The good thing is that I'm so angry with her that I don't feel sad about not having her around.
column11: I bet you that she regrets what she's done. You are such a good catch! She really lost out, didn't she?
column12: I guess so.
column13: So I don't think you'll have a problem finding another girlfriend. There are plenty of fish in the sea!

column1: hi, darling! I have a one-month vacation saved up. How about a trip to Europe?
column2: I could go for that. But I'm afraid our budget is a little tight this year.
column3: oh, but I really need to leave this town for a change. Working day after day has worn me out. Do you have any other suggestions?
column4: we should probably think about going somewhere that isn't too far away. How about the countryside? There must be many interesting places, and we could enjoy the fresh air and the delicious local spec
column5: wonderful! I think that's a great idea. How soon until we can make this happen? I can't wait!
column6: tomorrow I have an appointment with my dentist. What about next Monday?
column7: perfect. I'll start preparing tomorrow. If we're going to drive, I'll need to fill up the tank.
column8: no need. I think it's still plenty full. Even so, I'd rather travel by bus or train. It would cost much less than driving. Oil prices are soaring nowadays, you know.
column9: we can take the train, that will be faster. I'll book the tickets tomorrow morning.
column10: great! Oh, one more thing, don't forget to check the weather before we go. I'd hate to get caught in the rain.
column11: no problem. I'm really looking forward to the coming week.
column12: Me, too. Now let's make a list for what we need to take with us.

column1: It seems that nobody in your class likes Paul.
column2: The boy is good for nothing.
column3: As a teacher, I don ’ t know how to help him.
column4: He is hopeless.

column1: Thank you for showing me your offices, Mr. Becker. I can see why Washington bureaucrats enjoy their jobs.
column2: Why do you say that?
column3: The city is beautiful, the off..., the offices are modern and comfortable, and the work is so interesting.
column4: Many people work for the federal government their entire adult lives. Government service can be a rewarding and secure career.
column5: Do you mean financially rewarding?
column6: Well, many positions pay salaries that are comparable to those in private industries.
column7: I ’ Ve always thought that most bureaucrats are lazy.
column8: Sometimes that ’ s true, but not usually. Most feds are honest, hard-working professionals. It ’ s hard to keep highly trained people, so the pay and working conditions have to be attractive.
column9: How much do you make?
column10: I ’ m a GS - 15. That ’ s high on the scale of workers, but even a GS - 1 is paid a living wage.

column1: I had a big argument with david yesterday. I hope he ’ s not still mad at me.
column2: what did you argue about?
column3: he borrowed some money from me and I needed it back. He said he didn ’ t have the money yet.
column4: well, he should pay you back. It ’ s only fair.
column5: yes, but is got angry with him too quickly. He probably thought that I mistrusted him. I shouldn ’ t have got angry.
column6: did you lend him a lot of money?
column7: not much. I had to pay an unexpected bill, so I needed the money back.
column8: well, talk to him about it next time you see him. He probably feels as bad about it as you do. Close friends sometimes have disagreements. It ’ s nothing unusual. Neither of you said anything r
column9: no, we didn ’ t. I guess you ’ re right. We should patch things up.
column10: of course you should. You wouldn ’ t want a silly argument to ruin a long friendship, would you?

column1: Excuse me. I'm looking for Bluemingdails. Could you tell me how to get there?
column2: Sure. It's very close actually.You go straight down this road. Then you turn left, at the next junction.
column3: Left the next junction. Ok.
column4: Bluemingdails is on the corner of that block. You see it as you turn left.Seriously, You can't miss it.It' s enormous.
column5: Thanks very much.

column1: Who's that man over there talking to James?
column2: Where? Oh, that's Henry.
column3: He's very handsome, isn't he? What's he like?
column4: He's very nice, actually, but rather eccentric.
column5: Really? I love eccentric people.
column6: Yes, but he may be too eccentric even for you.
column7: Why? What do you mean by that?
column8: Well, haven't you heard?
column9: Heard what? No one ever tells me anything.
column10: Well, apparently, he's been having an affair with his secretary.
column11: Really! How fascinating.
column12: According to Mary, he's divorcing his wife and there's a big fight going on about the children. I thought everyone knew.
column13: Well, what can I say? I didn't know. Oh, I meant to tell you earlier, your blouse doesn't really match your skirt. Those colors don't really suit you either.
column14: Oh. Thanks. Look, I must just go and say hello to someone. I'll be right back.

column1: Hello! How are you.
column2: Not too well! I ’ m just to the doctor. I haven ’ t been feeling too well over the last few days.
column3: What have you got? A cough? A cold?
column4: That ’ s the funny thing. I don ’ t what ’ s wrong with me. I just feel exhausted.
column5: Perhaps you ’ Ve been working too hard. You do have a high-pressure job.
column6: Maybe. I haven ’ t been able to keep my food down either. That ’ s unusual.
column7: Well. I ’ m sure the doctor will be able to prescribe something to make you well again. Dr. Jameson is very good.
column8: Yes, he is. I ’ Ve make an appointment for 10 o ’ clock, so I ’ d better move along.
column9: OK. Hope you feel better soon. You should take it easy. I ’ m sure the doctor will prescribe rest, you know.

column1: Excuse me. Will you please keep an eye on my suitcase? I just want to make a phone call.
column2: Certainly, but will it take long?
column3: No, I'll be right back.
column4: OK. I'll look after it then.

column1: Mike, come and look at this painting of shrimp! It is so simple yet so vivid!
column2: Yeah. It is incredible! Is it the work of Qi Bakshi?
column3: Yes, it is. How do you know that?
column4: Well, Qi is famous all over the world, isn ’ t he? Besides I am quite interested in Chinese painting.
column5: Cool! What kind of Chinese painting do you prefer, free sketch or claborate-style painting?
column6: I prefer free sketch, especially the landscape paintings. I can always feel peace and harmony from those landscape paintings.
column7: That's true. Chinese art stresses the harmony between man and nature, which is an important part of China's traditional culture.
column8: I love this art exhibition!
column9: So do I. Let ’ s go to other areas to see what they have got, shall we?
column10: OK.

column1: Hey, Shirley! Want to join me for lunch... my treat!
column2: Wow! Sure!
column3: I must confess I have an ulterior motive for asking you to lunch.
column4: Oh... that's OK... as long as you're buying!
column5: I really want to pick your brain about something I've been thinking a lot about.
column6: I'd love to help if I can.
column7: Well, as you know, I have a Bachelor's degree in English literature and that's served me well so far, but I've always wanted to do some post-graduate work... maybe even get a Doctorate!
column8: Wow! Just the idea of going back to school fills my head with pain.
column9: But you have a Master's degree... hasn't that helped your career?
column10: Yeah, I'd have to say it has. But I'm still paying for it, you know.
column11: I know education is expensive, but it's been my lifelong dream. Call me crazy, but I've always wanted to have that PhD at the end of my name.
column12: Well, getting a Doctorate degree would mean close to a decade of school. Can you afford that? Can you survive that?
column13: I certainly can't afford it, but I'm sure I could find some good student loans.
column14: I think you need to separate the dream of having a PhD from the reality of years of more schooling. It's not as romantic as you might think.
column15: Yeah... I keep thinking about what I'll do with a Master's or Doctorate. I love language but I don't think there are a lot of well-paying jobs out there for experts on Shakespeare.
column16: Uh huh, that's for sure. You might find that your only career choice is teaching other graduate students.

column1: let's go swimming.
column2: But, we just finished eating lunch.
column3: I know, but I'm really hot.
column4: I'd strongly recommend that you wait for a while before going swimming.

column1: Welcome aboard.
column2: Excuse me, Miss. Can you show me my seat?
column3: Let me have a look at your boarding pass. It's E - 6, the sixth seat by the aisle.
column4: Thanks a lot.

column1: Did you find everything ok today?
column2: Yes, I did. By the way, in case there is a flaw in this CD player, can I return it?
column3: Yes. But you must return it within 30 days.
column4: Is there a charge for that. I know other stores have a restocking fee.
column5: There will be no charge at all. However you must show us the receipt. Could you sign it here, please?
column6: Thank you.
column7: All right. Keep you receipt. If something comes up, you can show it to us and we will give you a refund.
column8: Thanks. I'll put it in a safe place.

column1: Room Service. May I help you?
column2: This is Room 603. I'm afraid that the heating system doesn't work. It's very cold here.
column3: Have you switched on the radiator?
column4: Yes. I have switched it on for a long time. The room is still very cold.
column5: We're terribly sorry for that. We'll send our staff io fix it now. Or do you want to change your room?
column6: I prefer not to move first.
column7: OK. Is it convenient for us to come now?
column8: Yes, please.

column1: Hey, How's it going?
column2: Not good. I lost my wallet.
column3: Oh, that's too bad. Was it stolen?
column4: No, I think it came out of my pocket when I was in the taxi.
column5: Is there anything I can do?
column6: Can I borrow some money?
column7: Sure, how much do you need?
column8: About 50 dollars.
column9: That's no problem.
column10: Thanks. I'll pay you back on Friday.
column11: That'll be fine. Here you are.
column12: What are you going to do now?
column13: I'm going to buy some books and then I'm going to the gas station.
column14: If you wait a minute I can go with you.
column15: OK. I'll wait for you.

column1: We are just going round the corner for a drink. Won't you join us?
column2: Well, I'd like to, but I am not sure I have time.
column3: Oh, come on! Just a quick one!
column4: All right, just a quick one.

column1: Good afternoon. I'll show you to your room.
column2: Thank you.
column3: Could you tell me which bags are yours?
column4: They're over there next to the door. Those three with green tags on them.
column5: Could you wait a moment? I have to get a trolley. May I see your room key, please?
column6: Sure, here it is.
column7: Thank you. Room 402. You're on the 4th floor. This way, please.

column1: Hello, Steven. Congratulations!
column2: Thank you.
column3: How's your married life?
column4: We're happy together now. We both think that we're a well-matched couple.
column5: That's very good. It's said that marriage is the Ab of love. But the words may not be right.
column6: The situation differs in person.

column1: Excuse me, sir. But please call an ambulance. My friend suddenly got a sharp pain in the stomach.
column2: Is he all right? There's a big hospital just around the corner.
column3: Oh, is there? Will you find someone to take us to the hospital then?
column4: All right, sir. I'll have someone to take you there. By the way, is he insured?
column5: Yes, he is.
column6: I'm glad to hear that. In case he's not insured, the hospital will never accepts any patient.

column1: Hey, Mark, long time no see.
column2: Julie! It's good to see you again. How have you been?
column3: Great. I just got back from a week's vacation in Thailand.
column4: Really? How was it?
column5: Fantastic! I didn't want to come back.
column6: I hear the beaches in Thailand are beautiful.
column7: They are. And not only that the people are friendly, but also the food is delicious, not to mention cheap.
column8: I do like Thai food. Did you see much of Bangkok?
column9: Not much. I've go enough city life in Beijing.
column10: I know what you mean. I could use a vacation myself.
column11: Hey, wouldn't it be great if we could go to Thailand together sometime?
column12: Yeah, it sure would.

column1: Excuse me. I don't think we have met before. My name is Mary Jenson.
column2: Oh, hello. I'm Bias Chettri.
column3: Good to meet you, Mr Chettri.
column4: Pleased to meet you too, Ms Jenson.

column1: So, you friend ’ s getting married on Saturday. What have you bought her as a wedding gift. I find is so hard to choose the right gift.
column2: My friend and her fiance had a really good idea. They have cut out pictures from catalogues and pasted them in a notebook. The picture are of things they want. People sign their name by the item they will buy.
column3: That ’ s clever! Then everyone knows that they are buying something the couple really want and there ’ s no chance of two people buying the same gift. What things were in the notebook?
column4: Most of the things were household appliance. You know, everything from an iron through a vacuum cleaner to a cooker. I think it ’ s an excellent way for everyone who knows the couple to help them set up home.
column5: So, what did you get them?
column6: I bought a sewing machine. I know that my friend likes making her own clothes, but her current sewing machine is quite old and has some problems.
column7: What ’ s wrong with it?
column8: She says that after several years of use, it ’ s not working properly. When she uses it, it makes a funny noise.
column9: Household appliance don ’ t seem to last for a long time nowadays.
column10: I think it ’ s because the manufactures are constantly bringing out new models. Because they know that we will buy the new models, the appliances don ’ t need to last more than five or ten years at most.

column1: Dan, Dan, dude. You have to come over to my house right now!
column2: Is everything OK?
column3: Just get over here! Come in! Quickly!
column4: So, since when is your house a bank?
column5: What do you mean?
column6: I mean, what ’ s up with the locks and iron bars on your windows.
column7: Security, Dan, security! You can never be too safe you know! A lot of sickos out there. Just the other day they caught that peeping tom red handed! Had a high power telescope and binoculars by his window.
column8: What ’ s the matter with you? Why are you acting all paranoid?
column9: Paranoid? I ’ m not paranoid! I ’ m cautious! You see Dan, we have to be on guard at all time! People just invade your privacy as if they knew you! Telemarketers, solicitors, even your bank! They have way too much information! I like to keep everything on a need to know basis.
column10: OK, well, what did you want to see me about?
column11: You are being watched! Be careful Dan! Be careful!

column1: Craig, what do you do for work?
column2: I'm still a student.
column3: What school do you go to?
column4: Boston University.
column5: That's a good school. What do you study?
column6: I'm studying English, math, and history. My major is English.
column7: How long have you been studying English?
column8: More than six years.
column9: That's a long time.
column10: Yeah, I started to learn English when I was in high school.
column11: No wonder your English is so good.
column12: Actually, it's not that good. I can read but I can't speak very well. I haven't had a lot of chance to practice.
column13: I see. Talking with other people is very important.
column14: Yes, but I still don't have many friends here yet.
column15: I'm having a party tonight at my apartment. You should come.
column16: Oh thanks for inviting me. I'd love to come.

column1: Mum, I have something for you today.
column2: What for?
column3: Don't you remember? Today is March 8th. It's Women's Day.
column4: Oh. I've really forgotten it.
column5: Now, close your eyes. ( Mum closes her eyes and Steven puts the present in her hand. )
column6: A silk scarf. I love it. Thank you very much. My lovely son.
column7: Happy Women's Day. I love you forever, Mum.

column1: What dressing would you like on the salad?
column2: French dressing, please.
column3: I beg your pardon?
column4: Oh, French dressing.
column5: Sorry, it's not available now. Anything else?
column6: We still prefer French dressing.
column7: Will you say it again?
column8: Who's your manager? Tell me! Would you?

column1: Hit' em high, hit' em low. Class of' 93 — let's go!
column2: Hi there, everyone. We hope you're having a good night!
column3: Wasn't that football game great! I just knew we'd win!
column4: The night is young, folks. Get some food and mingle with those faces from yesterday.
column5: Later we'll let you know who the King and Queen of the Reunion will be.
column6: But for now, the band is playing the songs from our senior year. Get out on that dance floor!

column1: Mr. Zhang, are you still there?
column2: Yes.
column3: Can she call you back? She is about to start a meeting.
column4: That will be fine.

column1: Alright, tell me what you think.
column2: Don't you think it ’ s a bit bright?
column3: Yeah, maybe you ’ re right. How about this outfit?
column4: This dress looks lovely on you, but it ’ s not very practical, is it?
column5: No, I don't have any plans to go to a formal dance any time soon, but I love the way it looks. I just had to try it on! What do you think about this? It ’ s casual, yet sophisticated.
column6: I like the jeans, but you need something to go with the top. It ’ s too plain on its own.
column7: How about this scarf, these earrings, AMD an anklet?
column8: That might be going overboard a bit. How about just that scarf with a bracelet?
column9: That ’ s a good idea. You have a lot of good fashion sense.
column10: Thanks. You ’ d be ok on your own. There are loads of fashion victims out there, and you are not one of them. Have you tried it on yet?
column11: Yep. Here it is. What do you think?
column12: That looks great. Just one more thing---you need some high heels with those jeans. Do you want a pair with a plain pattern or ones with a leopard print on them?
column13: The leopard print sounds fabulous. Are they a name brand?
column14: No, they ’ re a Prada knock-off for 1/10 of the price of the real thing.
column15: That ’ s even better than the real thing.
column16: If I were you, I ’ d buy that now while it ’ s on sale. If you spend $ 100, you get a $ 50 voucher for more clothes.
column17: It ’ s too bad I did all that shopping yesterday!

column1: Well, Peter, you have to do better than that next time, won ’ t you?
column2: Have I really got to do those exams again, Dad?
column3: Of course, you have. You must try harder this time.
column4: And must I go back to school?
column5: No, you needn ’ t do that. You ’ d better get a part-time job somewhere and go to evening classes.
column6: But Dad, I should be working full-time at my age. I ’ m nearly 17.
column7: You ought to have worked harder then you wouldn ’ t have failed your exams. You have to take a job and study.
column8: What else I ’ Ve got to do? Join the army?
column9: Who knows! That might come to later.

column1: Can I help you?
column2: I'd like to buy some Chinese-style cakes. Could you recommend me some?
column3: Certainly. What about moon cake? It's typical Chinese food.
column4: Moon cakes? What is that?
column5: The moon cake is round and looks like the full moon. That's why it's called the moon cake and the moon cake symbolizes family reunion and harmony.
column6: Sounds very interesting. I'll buy some to family people.
column7: All the moon cakes are generally classified into two styles, Cantonese style and Suzhou style.
column8: What's the difference between these two styles?
column9: The skin of Cantonese style cakes is soft and puffy with heavy stuffing while the skin of Suzhou style cakes is puffy filled with fragrant nuts.
column10: Get me some of each.
column11: OK, here you are.

column1: I'm here to express my congratulations to you on your birthday. And I wish you many happy returns of the day. Here is a birthday present for you.
column2: Many thanks for your presence.

column1: Honey, have you all packed?
column2: Almost ready. I am making a double check.
column3: It is cold on the mountain. Have you packed the windshelled clothes and bodywarmers?
column4: Of course. And I have also packed two umbrellas just in case of raining.
column5: You are so thoughtful. Do you think our tent will be working well?
column6: Of course. I just bought it last year.
column7: What about our mobile phones and cameras? Did you charge them last night?
column8: Yes, I did. Don't worry.
column9: Good. We should tell our neighbour that they can call the police if some emergency happens to us.
column10: Yes. You think a lot, too.

column1: How old are you?
column2: That's a secret.

column1: We will go to climb up the hill tomorrow. Let's go to supermarket to buy some food.
column2: Yes, we can have a picnic on the top of the hill.
column3: What should we buy?
column4: Let me see. We should go to buy some fruit first.
column5: It is heavy and not convenient to take them to the top.
column6: How about taking a cantaloupe? It is light and sweet. Children love it.
column7: Good idea. We can buy some candy and nuts for children.
column8: Yes. Look, cashew, peanuts, assorted biscuits, chocolate, canned goods, anything else?
column9: That's enough for the kids. Get some drinks.
column10: Definitely beer. Two bottles.
column11: Right. We should buy some yoghurt for kids.
column12: Yes. Shall we buy some saucers? It will be used during our picnic.
column13: OK. Four saucers. We can buy some custard tarts tomorrow morning.
column14: Let's go to queue up. There are so many people in the lines.

column1: Hey Mike. What are you doing?
column2: Nothing much. What are you up to?
column3: I was just concerned about Sam. He hasn't been himself lately.
column4: He took the civil service exam and failed.
column5: That sucks. He must feel depressed.
column6: Yeah. He's been sitting in his room everyday for the last 4 days.
column7: Why don't we take him out? We can try to take his mind off of it. In the least show him that we're there for him.
column8: That's a great idea. Why don't you call him. I already talked to him a couple of times and it might be good for him to hear from somebody else.
column9: Ok. I'll call you back after I'm done.
column10: Sounds good.

column1: Thanks for inviting me over for dinner this evening.
column2: You're welcome.
column3: It looks delicious.
column4: Well here. Help yourself to some shrimp. It's fresh.

column1: May I help you? Miss!
column2: Yes. I'd like to look at lipstick and eye shadow.
column3: What color set do you prefer?
column4: Well, brown.
column5: We have a beautiful selection of eye shadows this fall. Look at the colors. Aren't they beautiful?
column6: But they're purple. I prefer a brown set.
column7: If you insist, I can show you the brown sets. I'll have to warn you that they're very ordinary, though.
column8: Well, I'm not so sure. Most of my make-up is brown.
column9: Why don't you wear purple eye shadow for a change? We also have lipstick to go with it.
column10: Can I try it?
column11: Sure. Are you wearing any make-up?
column12: No.
column13: Have a seat, please. Now, here is the mirror. How do you like it?
column14: Not bad. Actually, it makes me look younger. I like it.
column15: Try the lipstick as well. See, how fresh and charming you look.
column16: You're right. I'll take them all.

column1: Have you heard of Paul?
column2: No, what?
column3: He's got a promotion.
column4: You're kidding.
column5: No, they made him vicepresident in charge of sells.
column6: Oh, I don't believe it. He is only being with the company for two years.
column7: Well, it's true. The board man last thirdly and they choice Paul.
column8: Well. Good for him.

column1: This is the last of the milk.
column2: I know. I intend to go to the store today.
column3: Would you get some of that new cereal we saw advertised on TV?
column4: Which one?
column5: You know... the one with the silly ad about how vitamins jump up and down.
column6: Oh, you mean' KIKES'?
column7: Yeah. That's the one.
column8: Well, I'll see. Sometimes the stores don't have some of the new kinds of cereal.

column1: I have to go home now, Jenny. Thanks for inviting me to your party.
column2: I'm glad you came. I hope you enjoyed it.
column3: I had a wonderful time.

column1: He said he will get married by the end of this month.
column2: Big talk, I ’ d say. He does not have a girlfriend yet.
column3: Who knows. After all, he is handsome and rich.

column1: I got a raise.
column2: I'm glad to hear that.

column1: How many cleaning ladies does your company hire?
column2: We have two cleaning ladies. But both of them have received little education.
column3: Most cleaning ladies are illiterate. But some of them do a very nice job.
column4: But I actually dislike another lady. She is more capable and seems to have ideas of her own. But the trouble is she Isa backseat driver with some of us. She would tell you what to do and where to put things.

column1: I ’ m sure that the boy will become nobody when he grows up.
column2: Be careful of what you say, or you ’ ll have to eat humble pie.
column3: Eat humble pie? Impossible, I ’ Ve never been wrong in judging boys like him.

column1: I dare you to talk to that girl.
column2: Okay, I will.

column1: Is this the Friendship Hospital? Please send an ambulance to 68 Hu Nan Road ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: Of course. It's urgent. I think the partie nt is suffering from acute appendicitis. He may die if not treated in time.
column4: All right, we'll come right away.
column5: ( after a while... ) Where's the patient?
column6: He's there in the room. He's very ill.
column7: Don't worry. We'll put him in the stretcher. You are coming with us? Step in please.
column8: Carry him into the emergency ward. Here we are.
column9: Help the patient bathe and change his clothes, nurse. Then bring him into the operating room.
column10: ( after a while... ) I'm his guide. What's the trouble with him, doctor

column1: Good evening, ma'am. Table for one?
column2: Yes, please.
column3: Will this table be all right?
column4: Actually, I'd like a booth by the window if that's possible.
column5: Certainly. How about this one?
column6: This will be fine, thanks.
column7: ( Handing her a menu ) Your waiter will be here in a minute to take your order.
column8: Thank you.

column1: This is tough to say, Jordan, but I think we should break up.
column2: Are you serious?
column3: Yes, I mean it.
column4: But why? Did I do anything wrong?
column5: No, we are just too different. This isn ’ t working.
column6: Hey, come on. It ’ s too early to say that. We can fix things.
column7: I have thought about it for a while. I think it ’ s time to move on for both of us.
column8: But I still love you.
column9: I ’ m sorry.
column10: I knew this would happen some day...
column11: Then why didn ’ t you talk to me?
column12: Well. It ’ s not all my fault, Anna...
column13: I don't want to argue with you anymore. This is going to be tough, but Let ’ s try and be friends.
column14: I would like that Anna, but I think I ’ ll need a little space for a bit.
column15: I think we ’ ll be better off if we are apart.
column16: Shall we keep pur friendship?
column17: Sure, let ’ s just be friends.

column1: Are you ready to order? May I suggest a veal?
column2: No, I'll have the fish please.
column3: The chicken is also nice.
column4: No, I want the fish.
column5: Our special tonight is lobster.
column6: Thank you, but I prefer the fish.
column7: Perhaps you'd enjoy the lamb.
column8: No, I like the fish.
column9: What ever you say?

column1: Excuse me, ma'am. Can you tell me where the nearest postoffice is?
column2: Of course. Go straight ahead. Turn right at the next street. You'll see a tall, yellow building.The post office is on the first floor.
column3: Do you mean that I go that way for one block, then turn right?
column4: Yes, you are right.
column5: Is it far?
column6: No, It's only about five minutes' walk.
column7: Thank you very much.
column8: It's my pleasure.

column1: Welcome!
column2: Would you give me a bottle of beer, please?
column3: With ice, sir?
column4: No, ice will spoil the taste.
column5: Anything else, sir?
column6: Yes. Something non-alcoholic, please.
column7: Fruit juice, milk or mineral water?
column8: A glass of juice please.
column9: Coming up immediately.

column1: Hi, what can I get for you?
column2: Hello, may I have a double cheeseburger?
column3: With everything on it?
column4: That sounds great.
column5: Did you want fries with your order?
column6: May I get a large order of curly fries?
column7: Did you want something to drink?
column8: Get me a medium Pepsi.
column9: Would you like anything else?
column10: No, thank you. That's it.
column11: No problem, that'll be $ 5.48.
column12: Thanks a lot. Keep the change.

column1: Excuse me. When's the next bus?
column2: The next bus will be here in four minutes.
column3: Oh, good. That'll be the number forty four?
column4: No, it's the number fifty-eight.
column5: So when's the next forty-four? Will it be here soon?
column6: No, it won't.
column7: So when will it be here then?
column8: Never.
column9: Never?
column10: That's right. The number forty-four doesn't stop here any more. Its stop is round the corner.

column1: What are you doing now, Steven?
column2: I am reading a book about money management.
column3: Oh, my God. Do you want to be a millionaire? I can see you are very crazy about money.
column4: Everyone wants to earn a lot of money. Don't you think so? What's more, I am interested in money management.
column5: No, you are wrong. Money can't buy happiness and health. I won't sacrifice my health in order to get money. In other words, I don't want to be a millionaire and I want to have more free time to enjoy life.
column6: Oh, I see. But a proverb says " Money makes the mare go. " I think it will be better if you have more money.
column7: Maybe you are right. Please take care of yourself when you make money. Anyway health is the most important thing.
column8: Thank you for your caring. I will.
column9: No thanks.

column1: Darling, I am back. What are you doing?
column2: I am washing clothes. Are you hungry now? Wait for a moment, I'll cook dinner for you. ( Steven bends his brows )
column3: B, should we get a maid?
column4: I can do all the housework. We don't need a maid.
column5: You have worked very hard in the office. If we can get someone to help you, you can have more rest.
column6: We really don't need to.
column7: You are a good wife, Julia. But you must take care of yourself.
column8: Give me some time to think about it.

column1: Excuse me, Miss.
column2: What can I do for you?
column3: I've just heard an announcement that my flight has been delayed.
column4: What's your flight number?
column5: Flight CA216 to Chengdu.
column6: Yes, it's true. It has been delayed.
column7: Could you please tell me why?
column8: Yes, of course. The delay is due to heavy rain.
column9: How long will the delay be? Do you have any further information about it?
column10: I am sorry, we don't know the extent of the delay at present. But according to the latest weather forecast, there will be a change in weather soon.
column11: We have to wait. Well, is it possible for the rain to stop before noon?
column12: It's hard to say. Weather is so changeable in the summer. Please listen to the latest announcement about your flight.
column13: Yes, I will. Thanks a lot. Bye!
column14: Bye

column1: Would you please show me the necklace in the window?
column2: Is this the one you want?
column3: No, the one next to it.
column4: Here you are.
column5: Thanks. What kind of stone is this?
column6: It's a ruby. It is from South Africa. Would you like to try it on?
column7: Yes, please. How much is it?
column8: It costs $ 200.
column9: It looks good. OK. I'll take it.

column1: There're traffic jam everywhere this hour of the day!
column2: I think something must be done.
column3: Yeah, we should have more roads built.

column1: What's the matter, sir? You look pale.
column2: I feel dizzy and weak. And I'm having this pain in my ear. I think I am sick.
column3: Are you often traveling by plane?
column4: No, this is the second time.
column5: That's right. It's normal if you don't often take the plane. Just relax a little bit.
column6: Why this happens to me when I am on the plane? I feel bad.
column7: Don't worry, sir. It's just because of the lower pressure.
column8: What should I do about it?
column9: You may feel much better if you chew some gum or peanuts.
column10: OK, thanks. Does it work really? I'll give a try.
column11: Are you feeling better now? Do you need some pills?
column12: Much better. Thank you. I just feel tired but I can't fall asleep.
column13: So, you'd better wear this eyeshade and you will sleep well.
column14: I am not used to wearing that. Thanks.
column15: If you try to adapt yourself to your destination's local time, you'll feel more comfortable. So please try to sleep, and have meals according to Los Angeles's time.
column16: Thank you so much.

column1: Did you go and buy your bus pass?
column2: No, I didn't.
column3: When are you going to go get it?
column4: I'm not sure where they sell bus passes at.
column5: Why didn't you just ask me?
column6: Where should I go?
column7: You can get one from student services.
column8: I had no clue that I could get it there.
column9: I already knew that.
column10: Thanks for letting me know.
column11: You're welcome.
column12: I'm going to go and get it right now.

column1: He has worked five years in that bank.
column2: He must be an experienced accountant.
column3: You said it.Let' s ask him to work in our bank.
column4: Great minds think alike.

column1: Who's the man that is kicking the boy?
column2: He's the poor kid's father.
column3: Does he often beat his son?
column4: Yes, very.

column1: I'm going to Ireland this summer.
column2: Are you going to take your children along?
column3: No, I'd like to go alone.
column4: Have a nice holiday!

column1: Maybe you should have told me first?
column2: Why?
column3: Because we're partners.
column4: I realize that but I needed to make a decision.

column1: Joanne, let ’ s not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is, okay? Let ’ s just get down to business and start dividing this stuff up fairly, so we can go our separate ways, alright?
column2: Fine with me. I just want to get this over with. It ’ s important we make a clean break. I should have signed a pre-nup.
column3: What was that?
column4: Nothing! Anyway, you ’ re right, there ’ s no reason this has to be nasty.My lawyer tells me you ’ Ve accepted our alimony proposal and the division of property, as well as the custody agreement - I keep the cat and you get the dog. So that ’ s done... finally.
column5: Let ’ s not go there, Joanne! Ok, so let ’ s start with the record collection, I ’ ll take the albums I contributed and you can have your cheesy disco albums back.
column6: Fine, but I ’ m keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me.
column7: I believe that was a wedding present to both of us, Joanne. And you hardly ever use it!
column8: He ’ s my grandfather, and he never really liked you anyway!
column9: Whatever! Alright, I ’ ll concede the silly gramophone, if you ’ ll agree that I get the silver tea set.
column10: How typical, when are you ever going to use a silver tea set? Fine! I don ’ t want to drag this out any longer than necessary. What ’ s next? What about these old photographs?
column11: Which ones? Let me have a look.Wow, look at that! That brings back memories... That?
column12: Our trip to Italy! I remember that day. We were going to visit the Trev fountain, and we got caught in the rain...
column13: ... and you looked so adorable with your hair all wet. I had to take a picture of you standing there in that little alley, smiling and laughing in the rain...
column14: Oh, we really did have fun back then, didn ’ t we?
column15: Oh, Joanne, are we making a big mistake? I know our relationship has been on the rocks for sometime but are you sure we can ’ t reconcile and try again? I still love you.
column16: Oh Jeff! I love you too! I ’ m so glad we didn ’ t have to decide who keeps the motorcycle.
column17: The motorcycle? But that ’ s mine!

column1: I'm hungry, let's order up something to eat.
column2: Ok, maybe we can order a soup and a salad from the restaurant down the street.
column3: I was thinking of getting a hamburger, fries and a chocolate sundae.
column4: You eat too much junk food. That sort of stuff clogs up your arteries and is very high in cholesterol.
column5: Well I never seem to gain weight so I don't mind.
column6: It's not only about getting fat or not, it's about being healthy. You could really have some health problems later on.
column7: How about pizza or maybe some fried chicken! Better yet, let's order some hot dogs!
column8: You are a lost cause.

column1: I don't think the teacher had a right to say that. The teacher was wrong to have accused her in front of the whole class.
column2: You've got to be joking! It's the teacher's right to say anything wants, and if she saw Myra cheating, she certainly had the right to say so.
column3: I agree she had the right to say something, but I feel she should have done it privately.
column4: You're right. If I were the teacher, I wouldn't have done that.

column1: Did you call me?
column2: Thank you for returning my call.
column3: What was your call about?
column4: I wanted to have a talk with you about your son.
column5: What did he do?
column6: He was messing around last week in class.
column7: Exactly what did he do?
column8: Even though I asked him not to, he kept speaking out in class.
column9: I don't know what his problem is.
column10: I need you to talk to him, if you don't mind.
column11: That won't happen again, I'm sorry.
column12: Thank you. Hopefully I won't have to call about him again.

column1: Excuse me, sir. May I go with you to claim my luggage? I am a stranger here.
column2: Sure, I have to go anyway. But the first place you need to go is immigration office. They ’ ll check your ticket, passport, visa and immunization record book. After that we can go to the baggage claim area.
column3: Thank you.
column4: This is my luggage, but it's too heavy. I can't move it. Could you help me get it out of the conveyer belt?
column5: Certainly, it's a pleasure.
column6: Where shall we go next?
column7: Customs.
column8: Ok.
column9: Do you have anything to declare?
column10: No, I don't.
column11: Would you like to open the suitcase, please?
column12: Sure.
column13: What's in the box?
column14: Chocolates.
column15: Are they liqueur chocolates?
column16: No, they are peppermint chocolates.
column17: How many cigarettes do you have?
column18: About a 100 and I have had them declared.
column19: Are you a visitor or a resident?

column1: Could you take us to the Fifth Avenue?
column2: Sure.Step in.
column3: Is the traffic very heavy this hour?
column4: No.But it's a bit strange today.

column1: What a lovely tapestry! Don't you think we could use one to decorate our room?
column2: I think we can have a try.
column3: Artistic tapestry is the highest form of expression of the rug weaving art, an exquisite handicraft of superb artistry in typical Chinese style.
column4: I see. Is this the marvelous landscape in Guiling?
column5: I think it is.
column6: Which do you prefer, the linen one, the figured dacron or the brocade?
column7: I prefer the linen one.

column1: I am sorry. I ’ Ve left my disk at home.
column2: Thank you all the same.

column1: You should have seen the T. V. show that was on last night, the topic it covered was really interesting, animal rights.
column2: Do you really believe in that? If they are going to focus on something, they should do it on civil rights.
column3: Yes, but we can ’ t deny that animals are vulnerable, defenseless, and are completely at the mercy of human beings.
column4: I understand your point, but we continue to have transgressions against human rights. If so much attention weren ’ t devoted to the topic of animals, we would then concentrate more on saving a human being instead of protecting a koala.
column5: You can ’ t compare apples and oranges. I believe that both topics are important and that we can ’ t ignore them, the mistreatment of animals can cause a great environmental imbalance. I believe that governments should prohibit activities like poaching.
column6: Well, you are right on that point. This is the reason that I don ’ t buy leather and I try to buy synthetic products.
column7: As long as you don ’ t treat it better than your wife, it ’ s fine.

column1: May, is the university a terrible place?
column2: Surely not. Life in the university is fun. Why did you ask?
column3: Because you study day in and day out for the entrance exam. So I figure you would study even harder after you ’ Ve got in.
column4: Studying in the university is not easy, but it's not as arduous as you think.
column5: How do you know that? You haven't got in yet.
column6: Of course I know. I once attended Lisa's class, sitting quietly at the back of the classroom.
column7: Oh, really? Were you not caught?
column8: Of course not. You are allowed to attend any lecture, only if there are empty seats for you and you don't disturb the class. In universities, you study in a free and creative environment.
column9: What do you want to study in the university? Have you thought about it?
column10: This question has really been bothering me. I like Chinese literature, you know. But economics is really hot now, and it has a very good career prospect.
column11: I will choose what I like. You don't know what a torture it is for me to study English, because I don't like English.
column12: Though I like Chinese literature very much, I'm also interested in economics. It's a tough choice to make.
column13: You can decide later. You will have choices before you submit your university application form.
column14: Right. I have lots of time to think carefully before I make my final decision.

column1: Do you speak English?
column2: Yes, a little.
column3: Can you tell me how to get to the Jade Buddha Temple?
column4: I'm sorry. I can't quite follow you. Would you mind speaking slowly?

column1: I ’ m going to be moving out soon.
column2: You still have time on your lease.
column3: There ’ s no way that I can stay here.
column4: That ’ s not going to be all right.
column5: I don ’ t understand why.
column6: I ’ m going to have to keep your deposit
column7: Why can ’ t I have it back?
column8: Because you ’ re leaving before your lease is over.
column9: You have to give it back to me.
column10: You ’ re not going to get it.
column11: But I ’ m not able to live here anymore.
column12: I can ’ t help you with that.

column1: Can I see some men's watches?
column2: Of course. How about this one?
column3: What functions does this watch have?
column4: It's a luminous watch with a time-reminder function.
column5: Is it waterproof?
column6: Yes, and it comes with a worldwide guarantee.
column7: I'll take it. Please set the watch for me.

column1: What reason do you have for missing school?
column2: I was sick.
column3: How were you sick?
column4: I had a stomachache.
column5: Did it get any better?
column6: I'm still feeling under the weather.
column7: Would you like anything for your stomach?
column8: I took something earlier.
column9: Get better.
column10: Thanks a lot.

column1: Hi Kara, it's Mike here.
column2: Hi Mike, how are you doing?
column3: I'm doing well, and you?
column4: Everything is going great.
column5: Kara, would you be interested in going to dinner again this Friday?
column6: Mike, I had a good time too, but I am getting ready to move back to the east coast, so I think I shouldn't get too involved right now.
column7: Well, we could just go out as friends.
column8: Right now, I think I need to really focus on matters at home, but thanks for a nice evening.

column1: How about this floor lamp?
column2: Fine, just get it! We have been shopping for furniture for five hours! I ’ m so tired!
column3: We still need to find an armoire and a dresser.
column4: Fine! I am going to go home and drop off this nightstand, coffee table and love seat while you look for the rest of the things.
column5: Great! Pick me up in about an hour because I think I ’ ll also get a bean bag and a dining set.
column6: While you are at it can you pick out a nice recliner? I really want one so I can watch TV.
column7: Recliner? In my beautifully decorated living room? I don ’ t think so!

column1: Honey, I've got good news for you.
column2: What is it?
column3: You are going to be a father.
column4: What? Do you mean that you are pregnant? Is it true?
column5: Yes. We'll have our baby soon.
column6: Oh, dear, I'm so happy.
column7: Me, too.

column1: Do you know which bus will take me from PHS to Sons?
column2: Which Sons do you want to go to?
column3: It's on Fair Oaks and Orange Grove.
column4: You actually need to catch two buses.
column5: Okay, which ones do I need to take?
column6: The first bus you need to get on is the 268.
column7: What do I do next?
column8: Once you get to Fair Oaks and Washington, get off.
column9: Then what should I do?
column10: You need to get on the 261. It goes all the way to Sons.
column11: Is that it?
column12: That's it.

column1: Waiter, the meat is overdone.
column2: I am sorry you don't like it, sir. But that's just the special point of the dish.
column3: Is it?
column4: Yes, hope you can enjoy it.

column1: Hello! My name is Sandals, I have a reservation.
column2: May I see your identification, please, sir?
column3: Here you are.
column4: Thanks. Do you have a credit card, sir?
column5: Of course. Will American Express do?
column6: I'm very sorry, sir. We accept only VISA or MasterCard.
column7: No problem. Here's my VISA.
column8: Thanks. Room 507 is a spacious, nonsmoking room, with a queen bed. Does that meet your expectations?
column9: Yes, that sounds like what I want.
column10: That's wonderful, sir. Now, here's your key. Should you need anything, just dial 0.

column1: You're really fit, Paul. Do you exercise very much?
column2: Well, I almost always get up very early, and I lift weights for an hour.
column3: You're kidding!
column4: No. And then I often go Rollerblading.
column5: Wow! How often do you exercise like that?
column6: About five times a week. What about you?
column7: Oh, I hardly ever exercise. I usually just watch TV in my free time. I guess I'm a real couch potato!

column1: What is your favorite pastime?
column2: Fishing. It's great fun.
column3: Is it? Mine is climbing mountains on Sunday mornings.
column4: No wonder you always look so active.

column1: You ’ re home late today, David. How was school?
column2: Not bad. There ’ s a new English teacher.
column3: Oh, what ’ s she like?
column4: She is beautiful.
column5: Is she old or young?
column6: She is quite young and her hair is blond.
column7: Is she strict?
column8: Not really. Her eyes are blue.
column9: Can she speak Chinese?
column10: Not much. She is very tall and slim.
column11: David, stop dreaming. It ’ s time to do your homework.

column1: Will you book a ticket to New York for me?
column2: Yes, sir.When do you want to leave here?
column3: This Saturday.
column4: Will, that'll be the sixth of September.
column5: That's right.Will you check what fights are available on the sixth of September?
column6: I'll check it over.Oh, there're three flights available that day.one at 2 p. m., one at 5 p. m. and the other at 9p. m.
column7: I'll have the 5 o'clock one.What time do I check in?
column8: 4 o'clock.
column9: Thank you.

column1: What can I help you with today?
column2: My washing machine isn't working.
column3: What's the problem?
column4: The water will not drain.
column5: Is there anything else wrong with it?
column6: No, that's it.
column7: I can come down and fix that for you if you'd like.
column8: When will you be able to fix it?
column9: How does this afternoon at 2:30 sound to you?
column10: That would be perfect.
column11: Alright, so I'll see you then?
column12: See you then.

column1: Didn't you say you were planning a trip to China? I heard the northwest and north of China are experiencing severe sandstorms!
column2: I was planning to go to Beijing first and then go to northwest China! Looks like I'm in trouble.
column3: Definitely. I heard Beijing was experiencing seven degree strong winds! That is nearly a record high!
column4: No way! I don't think I've ever encountered winds that strong! Are the storms affecting land and air transportation?
column5: Absolutely! I don't think any planes are going anywhere. The sand being blown around has cut visibility in Beijing to less than 100 meters. But inseems Gansu Province is being hit the hardest.
column6: That's exactly where I was planning to go!
column7: Well, this storm originated in the plateaus in northwest China. At the moment, that area is calmer.

column1: What in the world is that smell?
column2: The aroma of roasting coffee beans.
column3: Smells like you're baking something. What are those?
column4: Green beans. They pop and turn brown when you roast them.
column5: Cool! But isn't that a hot air popcorn popper?
column6: This machine roasts the beans just right. If you roast them too long, or the temperature is too hot...
column7: The beans will burn. I know. I've tasted burnt coffee before... yuck!

column1: Good morning. May I help you?
column2: I'd like to rent a car, please.
column3: Okay. Full-size, mid-size or compact, ma'am?
column4: Full-size, please. What's the rate?
column5: 78 dollars a day with unlimited mileage.
column6: And I'd like to have insurance just in case.
column7: Is there an additional driver?
column8: No.
column9: If you want full coverage insurance, it will be 8 dollars per day. It includes collision damage waiver and personal accident insurance.
column10: All right. I'll take it.
column11: Here is our brochure, ma'am. Err... full-size... OK. Please choose a model in this section.
column12: How about this one?
column13: All right. How many days would you like to use it?
column14: Just one day.
column15: May I see your driver's license and credit card please?
column16: Is the international driving licence fine?
column17: Yes, it is. (... ) Thank you. Please fill in this form. Can you check this box, and put your initials here, and again here.

column1: Are you feeling better today, Bill?
column2: Well, it's hard to say. I cough a lot in the evening.
column3: You'd better give up smoking. It's bad for your health.
column4: You're right, but you know, it's hard to give up an old habit.
column5: But you should make up your mind first.
column6: You know, I often have to work til late at night. I need something to keep me awake.
column7: Why don't you go to bed and get up early? You'll have the same time for work.
column8: Thank you for your advice! I'll try it.

column1: Good morning, Linda. How have you been?
column2: Pretty bad. I ’ Ve had a bad cold for three days and still can ’ t get rid of it.
column3: I ’ m sorry to hear that. Is there anything else I can do?
column4: No, thanks.
column5: Well, I hope you ’ ll feel better soon.
column6: Thank you for your concern.

column1: Tom! How are you? We missed you at the party last night. Are you OK?
column2: I don ’ t know. I didn ’ t really feel like going out. I guess I ’ m feeling a little homesick.
column3: Come on. We ’ Ve been through this already! Look, I know the adjustment was hard when you first got here, but we agreed that you were gonna try and deal with it.
column4: I was. It ’ s just that the holidays are coming up and I won ’ t be able to home because I can ’ t afford the airfare. I ’ m just longing for some of the comforts of home, like my mom ’ s cooking and being around my family.
column5: Yeah, it can get pretty lonely over the holidays. When I first got here, I ’ d get depressed and nostalgic for anything that reminded me of home. I almost let it get to me, but then I started going out, keeping myself busy and before I knew it, I was used to to it.
column6: I see what you mean, but I ’ m still bummed out.
column7: OK. how does this sound, let ’ s get you suited up and hit the dance club tonight. I hear that an awesome DJ is playing and there will be a lot of pretty single girls there!
column8: You know, I could really go for that. You don ’ t mind being my wingman for tonight?
column9: Not at all! It be fun! It will be like a boys ’ night out... well kinda...
column10: Great! I must warn you though, whatever happens, don ’ t let me go on a drinking binge. Trust me, it ’ s not a pretty picture!

column1: Is anybody here?
column2: Coming. What do you want today?
column3: Quite a lot. I need one pound of potatoes, three pints of milk, a dozen eggs and one pound of tomatoes.
column4: Our fruit is very fresh today. Do you want some?
column5: How much are the lemons?
column6: Three for ten cents.
column7: Give me a dozen lemons.
column8: Anything else?
column9: No, thanks. How much in total?
column10: Twenty eight dollars.

column1: Are you still coming to my place for dinner tomorrow night?
column2: Of course. Is the dinner still on?
column3: Yes, I was just wondering how you and your roommate were planning on coming to my place.
column4: We were planning on walking both ways since the weather is still nice.
column5: That's what I thought you would do. Listen, I live in a bit of a rough neighborhood. It's just down the street from all the bars. You probably don't want to be walking around after dark.
column6: It can't be that bad.
column7: I wish it wasn't, but there is actually a lot of crime and prostitution around here.
column8: Really? I never would have guessed. The criminals must only come out in the evenings, because I've never noticed anything strange when I've been at your house in the daytime.
column9: Do me a favor, and take a taxi. It'd make me feel a lot better.
column10: Ok, we will. How do you get around in the evenings?
column11: When I first moved in, I walked everywhere. But within a week, I had my purse stolen — just a block away from the police station! Now, I always take public transportation.
column12: Has anything else happened to you?
column13: Nothing else has happened to me, but I have seen quite a few fights on the streets after the bars close.
column14: Well, we'll be careful. Thanks for letting me know.

column1: Get changed!
column2: What for?

column1: Good morning golf aficionados! My name is Rick Fields, and you guessed it, I am here with my main man, Bob Copeland.
column2: Thank you, Rick! As you can see, ladies and gentleman, we are here in beautiful Pebble Beach where the top golfers in the world are trying to win the grand prize of one million dollars!
column3: Whoa, that ’ s a lot of cash! Let ’ s go to the course and see how Tiger Woods is doing.
column4: All right, we are here at the eighth hole. It ’ s a par four, and has some very difficult hazards which many golfers find difficult to avoid. Although, I did see Jack Nicklaus hit a hole in one on this very same hole!
column5: Tiger Woods is about to tee off, and let ’ s see if he has the same luck as Jack. Tiger is asking his caddie for his driver and, he seems to be very nervous.
column6: Oh no! Not a good swing at all! It ’ s definitely not his day today. On the seventh hole he got a bogey and before that he barely made par. He will definitely not get a birdie on this shot.
column7: It seems that his ball has flown somewhere deep in the trees. He is having a hard time finding it and even his caddie has climbed a tree to try and spot it.
column8: Oh no! A bear! Run, Tiger, run! Somebody call animal control!

column1: Linda, it's really late. Let's call it a day.
column2: Good idea. We can finish this project the first thing tomorrow morning.
column3: Sure thing. Do you want me to give you a ride home?
column4: That ’ s great. Thanks for the ride. I really appreciate 1 it. You know my car is still in the shop.
column5: Don't mention it. It ’ s my pleasure.
column6: It's very nice of you.

column1: What a washing machine! It ’ s getting worse today. Look! Now it doesn ’ t work at all. I think I need a new one.
column2: Here ’ s an ad. about a big sale of washing machine. Do you want to see it?
column3: Of course! Let ’ s have a look. Great! In my frame of mind, I ’ d like to buy one today.

column1: I wish I knew who had moved our flower pots.
column2: It was me. I am so sorry.
column3: What did you think you were doing?
column4: I had to move it, so that I can get my bike through.
column5: How dare you be so inconsiderate? That's wrong.
column6: I am awfully sorry. I didn't think you would mind so much.
column7: Never do that again.
column8: I promise.

column1: The teacher just canceled the test.
column2: Are you kidding?

column1: Okay, I ’ ll take it. By the way, do you have delivery service?
column2: You don ’ t need to carry the furniture home because we have delivery service.
column3: Do you charge for delivery?
column4: Wo will deliver the goods to you for free.
column5: Very good. Could you deliver it to this address?
column6: Sure. Please write down your name and your phone number.
column7: OK. Can you tell me the delivery time?
column8: No later than tomorrow.
column9: Thanks.

column1: Who's it knocking at the door?
column2: I think it's the postman.Will you go and open the door?
column3: All right. I'll get it.

column1: Excuse me. How much is the chocolate bar?
column2: One dollar.
column3: So, I can have five for five dollars?
column4: Actually, you can only have four.
column5: Oh, yeah. I forgot tax. Give me four then, please.
column6: Okay. Thanks.

column1: May I help you?
column2: Do you have the latest lipstick from Christian Dior?
column3: Yes. What colors do you like?
column4: Any special colors?
column5: How about this one?
column6: Can I try it on and see how it looks?
column7: Of course. This product moisturizes at the same time.
column8: Looks good. I'll take it.

column1: May I have a look at that vase, please?
column2: Of course. It's the best one I have here---and it's only 300 yuan.
column3: Oh, it's really nice, but to tell the truth, that's far too expensive.
column4: Really? Even for such an excellent one?

column1: I'll try one of these on. ( The customer tries one of the shoes on. ) It's too big. It slides up and down my heel when I walk around.
column2: Well, let's try a size ten. ( He gets another pair and the customer tries a shoe on. ) Looks like a perfect fit.
column3: Not really. It pinches my toes.
column4: I'm sure they'll be fine once you break them in.
column5: I don't know... well, I guess I'll take them, since you don't seem to have anything better.
column6: Thank you, ma'am. It's been a pleasure doing business with you.

column1: That's a very nice pair of glasses.
column2: Does it really look OK?
column3: Yes, and I like the color too. It matches your eyes.
column4: And I got it on sale.
column5: That's incredible!

column1: Why are you all dressed up?
column2: I've got a date.

column1: I just love your hair that way.
column2: Thanks.
column3: Where did you have it done?
column4: My sister did it. When did you get yours cut?
column5: Just yesterday. I'm still getting used to it.
column6: Well, it looks very nice.
column7: Thanks.

column1: Hi. I want to get something nice for my niece.
column2: Well, I've never heard of a little girl that didn't love Barbie dolls.
column3: I like that suggestion. Show me one, please.
column4: Here you go — Digital Barbie.
column5: Oh, my niece will love her! How much for her?
column6: Barbie is our best seller. She's only $ 29.95.
column7: That's great. I'll take her.
column8: Your niece will love this. Anything else?
column9: Thank you, but no. This will do it for now.
column10: With the tax, your total is $ 32.42. Would you like to charge it?
column11: I'll pay cash, thank you.
column12: Thank you for shopping here.

column1: Hello, sir. Is there anything I can help you find?
column2: Um... Uh... I'm just looking, thanks.
column3: Need a gift for your girlfriend or wife?
column4: No, no, no. I'm just browsing. Thanks anyway.
column5: Well, if you need anything, just ask.
column6: Um... well, where's the men's shoe department?
column7: It's on the third floor. Turn left when you get off the escalator.

column1: Well, here is your breakfast!
column2: Thanks so much. Miss, I believe I ordered my eggs scrambled, and these are fried.
column3: Sorry, your friend over there ordered fried eggs, and I gave you his by mistake.
column4: Oh yeah. Here, I will just trade with him.
column5: Here are your pancakes, madam.
column6: But I ordered waffles!
column7: Oh, I am so sorry!
column8: That's OK. I will eat my eggs and bacon, and you can take my pancakes back.
column9: Good, sir. I will take care of that right away.
column10: Thank you so much!

column1: Do you like flowers?
column2: Of course, I like.
column3: What's your favorite flower?
column4: Forsythia. It's also called winter jasmine which is the symbol of the spring's arrival.
column5: Spring is a lively season.
column6: Yes. How about you?
column7: I admire plum blossoms very much. It seems that only it can blossom in the cold winter.
column8: You have a perfect taste!
column9: It is the symbol of laughing at hoar frost and fighting with snow. I admire the bravery of plum blossoms.
column10: But it used to be ignored by many people.
column11: The bright people will remember it forever.
column12: Well, it's snowing. Let's enjoy the plum blossoms when snowing.

column1: What do we need for the barbecue?
column2: Well, I ’ Ve bought a lot of meat. I ’ Ve got pork chops, small steaks, chicken wings and plenty of hot dog sausages and hamburger patties.
column3: I can ’ t wait to start cooking. I ’ Ve bought the grill and charcoal.Do you have enough plates and utensils?
column4: I think so. I bought some paper plates and cups for people to use.It will save on the washing up.
column5: And if people drop them, they won ’ t break.We ’ ll need to buy some buns to make hot dogs and hamburgers.
column6: They sell them at the shop around the corner.We can go and get some in a few minutes.
column7: I brought some cheese to make cheeseburgers and some onions for the hot dogs.We ’ ll need some tomato catchup and some barbecue sauce.
column8: I have the sauce, but remind me to get some catchup at the shop.
column9: How long does it take to cook meat on the barbecue?
column10: It only takes a few minutes.Some people like their meat well done, others like it rare.The great thing about the barbecue is that everyone can choose how they want their meat cooked.
column11: They can cook them themselves to make sure exactly how they like it.
column12: I hope you haven ’ t invited any vegetarians.

column1: What kind of person do you consider yourself to be?
column2: I think I'm polite, careful, relaxed and shy.
column3: Oh, I don't think you're shy! You are always chatting with new people when we go to a party.
column4: Well. Yes, but those people always start talking to me. I never talk to them first. Perhaps I'm not as shy as I think. Anyway, you're certainly not shy!
column5: You're right. I love going out and making new friends.
column6: So, you'll be at my birthday party on Friday?
column7: Of course!

column1: Morning, Mom.
column2: I made a doctor's appointment for you.
column3: No, I'm fine. I don't need to see a doctor.
column4: Then I guess you're healthy enough to clean your room before school.
column5: OK. I'll go see the doctor.
column6: Bundle up. It's wet and rainy out there. Here's some soup.
column7: Chicken soup again?
column8: Soup does the body good, sweetie. It's what you need when you're under the weather.

column1: Have you applied for you visa to go to study in the united states yet?
column2: Yes, I have. I handed in my application form two weeks ago and I ’ m going for an interview next week.
column3: Good luck! I ’ Ve heard it ’ s very difficult to get a visa to go to the united states.
column4: The application form are quite complicated. It took me a few hours to fill it out. The hardest thing was getting all the necessary documents. That took almost two weeks.
column5: What kind of documents did you need to present?
column6: I had to show document relating to my financial status and of course my education, because I want a student visa.
column7: Why do you think so many people have their applications rejected?
column8: I think that they don ’ t complete the forms correctly or they don ’ t include all the required documents. The embassy is very strict about it. You have to be quite careful.
column9: Why are they stricter with Chinese people than with other nationalities?
column10: That ’ s simple. Many people break the rules regarding their visa conditions.

column1: R :: Good morning. Room Reservations. May I help you?
column2: Yes, I ’ d like to reserve a room.
column3: R :: Thank you, sir. For which date and how many guests will there be in your party?
column4: From April 16th to 20th. Just my wife and myself.
column5: R :: From April 16th to 20th.And which kind of room would you prefer, sir?
column6: A Twin, please.
column7: Could you hold the line please? I ’ ll check our room availability. ( After a while ) Thank you for waiting, sir. We have a twin room at US $ 180 per night, will that be all right?
column8: Ok, I ’ ll take it.
column9: Thank you, sir. May I have your name and phone number, please?
column10: Sure. May name is Aaron Johnson, and my phone number is 3242-5827.
column11: R :: Mr. Aaron Johnson, phone number is 3242-5827. Excuse me, how do you spell your first name?
column12: It ’ s double A, R, O, N.
column13: Double A, R, O, N. Thank you, Mr. Johnson. May I know your arrival time on April 16th?
column14: Around 9 p. m.
column15: Mr. Johnson, for the unguaranteed reservation, we can only hold the room by 6 p. m., because it is the peak season now. If you make a guaranteed reservation, we can hold the room overnight. Would you like to make a guaranteed reservation by credit card?
column16: Fine. Do you accept American Express?
column17: Yes. May I know the number?
column19: Thank you, Mr. Johnson. You ’ Ve made a guaranteed reservation at the Guangzhou xx Hotel, from April 16th to 20th for 5 nights. If you can ’ t arrive as schedule, please inform us before 6 p. m. on April. hank you for calling and we look forward to serving you

column1: What is wrong with Peter? He sure looks unhappy.
column2: His girlfriend dumped him, and he is tearing his heart out over her.
column3: How foolish he is. The girl is inviting. She often makes a pass at boys.
column4: Love is blind, you know.

column1: Carrie, I want to buy a pair of leather shoes to wear for the interview tomorrow.
column2: Why don't we go shopping?
column3: Good idea. Let's go. Where should we go?
column4: Let's go to Julian Store.

column1: I need to purchase some business cards.
column2: No problem. How many are you thinking about?
column3: I think 2,000 would be fine.
column4: If you'll just fill out this form, please.
column5: I want the new cards to be exactly like this card.
column6: We can do that very easily.
column7: ... Okay, I'm done. Here's the form and my old card.
column8: Great. Your order will take only one week.
column9: You know, I think it would be better if I could pick it up in three days.
column10: We can do that. It'll just cost you extra.

column1: Can you help me please?
column2: Certainly sir.
column3: Do you know if there is Japanese restaurant near the hotel?
column4: Actually there ’ s one on the same street as this hotel.
column5: Is it far?
column6: Not at all. Turn left out of the hotel and it's about a five minute walk.

column1: Did you promise me to get the bread?
column2: Well, I remember walking pass the baker shop.
column3: But you forgot to get the bread.
column4: I'm afraid so. I don't remember you telling me about it.
column5: Well, I certainly did.
column6: What would you let me do now?
column7: You are free. You can go now.
column8: Really? You are so kind.
column9: I'll do with the cake.
column10: No. That's not enough. I've got some cereal.

column1: The restaurant across the street hired a new Chinese chef, so I ordered some Chinese food there for this evening.
column2: Good. I love Chinese food. What did you order?
column3: Something hot and spicy. They look very inviting on the menu. You are going to love them.
column4: Maybe we can find a place to learn some Chinese cooking. I hear there's a place in Chinatown where you can take some courses. Are you interested?
column5: I'm not sure. I don't enjoy cooking that much. As long as we can order it from a restaurant, we don't have to learn to do it by ourselves.
column6: You are right. But I just want to know how they prepare food and make it taste so different.

column1: Good morning. How can I help you?
column2: I want to apply for a passport here.
column3: OK. Please fill in these forms and take them back when you are done.
column4: ( 10 minutes later. ) Hi. Here are completed forms.
column5: OK. Can I have your original ID card and tw0 2 - inch photos?
column6: Here you are, But I forgot my photos.
column7: That is OK. We have photo taking service here. You may pay your fee, take a photo there and take it back here.
column8: OK. I am going right now.

column1: You are studying here, aren ’ t you?
column2: Yes. I have been here for three years.
column3: Do you like this campus?
column4: Well. I ’ m rather disappointed with it.
column5: How come?
column6: It ’ s too old. And it isn ’ t as specious as I expected.
column7: Oh.It ’ s awful, but it can ’ t be helped.
column8: I ’ ll just have to put up with it.

column1: It seems that you get antsy when you hear I praise another guy.
column2: I get antsy not because you praise a guy, but because you may be taken for a ride by a guy like him.
column3: How come you think of him that way?
column4: Because you seem to have lost your vigilance. You should be on the watch out.
column5: I have no reason to distrust him. He's never caused any harm.
column6: Isn't there anything that sounds fishy?
column7: Nothing smells a rat. I told you that he's an all-right guy.
column8: All-right guy? All right. Let's talk about something else instead.

column1: Excuse me. Have you forgotten our drinks?
column2: Sorry, I'll bring them to you right away.
column3: Why is it taking so long?
column4: We are short of staff today.
column5: There is something wrong with this dish.
column6: What's wrong?
column7: I don't think this is fresh.
column8: They were delivered this morning.
column9: Would you please ask the manager to come over?

column1: Tom, I married Julia last month. Have you already known it?
column2: No, I haven't. I'm so surprised at the news.
column3: Indeed, we got married too soon.
column4: Congratulations. But have you heard the proverb that if one gets married too hurriedly one may regret it for a long time?
column5: Yes. However, I believe that marriage comes by destiny. I knew I would marry Julia when I met her at the first time.
column6: How's your married life?
column7: We're happy together now.
column8: I have to say you're a well-matched couple.
column9: Thank you!

column1: What are you looking for?
column2: I lost one of my contact lenses, and I ’ m searching high and low for it.
column3: Where did you lose it? Maybe I can help you to find it.
column4: Thank you very much. I think I lost it near the window.

column1: May I serve your dishes now?
column2: No, I'm used to having tea first.
column3: With sugar?
column4: No sugar, please.

column1: I have a sore throat and my chest hurts.
column2: How long have you been like this?
column3: Two or three days now.
column4: I think you've got the flu. There's a lot of it going around.
column5: What do you think I ought to do?
column6: Get this prescription filled and go straight to bed.

column1: Is this the right counter to check in for this flight?
column2: Yes, it is. Please put your luggage on this scale.
column3: OK. Is the plane on schedule?
column4: Yes, it is. How many pieces of hand luggage do you have?
column5: Two.

column1: May I see your passport please?
column2: Yes. Here it is.
column3: Are you travelling for business or pleasure?
column4: I'm going to visit some relatives here for several months.
column5: Do you have anything to declare? Jewellery or cash?
column6: The only things I brought were some cloths and my notebook computer.
column7: Did you bring any fruits, vegetables, fresh meats or plants into this country?
column8: No, Sir, I did not.

column1: Did you hear about Bob and Mary?
column2: No, what happened?
column3: They had an argument and split up.
column4: Really, what's going to happen now?

column1: Room service.
column2: Good morning. This is room 113. I'd like some breakfast, please.
column3: Right. Excuse me. Mrs. Jones?
column4: That's right.
column5: What can I do for you?
column6: I'd like some grapefruit juice, marmalade, two scrambled eggs with two sausages, toast, and a pot of black coffee, please. How long will it take?
column7: Just a few minutes, ma'am.
