column1: Pretty! Say beautiful rather. Can you imagine any thing nearer perfect beauty than she altogether-face and figure?
column2: I do not know what I could imagine, but I confess that I have seldom seen a face or figure more pleasing to me than hers.
column3: Such an eye! The true hazel eye-and so brilliant! Regular features, open countenance, with a complexion, Oh! What a bloom of full health, and such a pretty height and size ; such a firm and upright figure! There is health, not merely in her bloom, but in her air, her head, her glance. One hears sometimes of a child being' the picture of health' ; now, she always gives me the idea of being the complete picture of grown-up health. She is loveliness itself.

column1: I heard you were on a date last night! So, how did it go? I want all the juicy details!
column2: Um... well, actually, we had a fantastic time last night. He was... amazing!
column3: Okay, now you really have to fill me in. What ’ s he like?
column4: He ’ s really good looking, he ’ s quite tall, around 6 ’ 1 ”, he ’ s in his early thirties, and he ’ s got the most beautiful dark brown eyes...
column5: He sounds hot! What does he do for a living?
column6: You know what, this is the best part. David is a junior investment banker at Fortune Bank, so he ’ s got a great career path ahead of him!
column7: Hold on a sec, his name is David?
column8: Yeah?
column9: That ’ s my brother!

column1: Hey, Frank, there is that Janet chick.
column2: Wow, what a great burd!
column3: She sure knows how to strut her stuff.
column4: She's a real turn-on, alright?
column5: And look out she's dressed.
column6: Yeah, I noticed. She must be really loaded.
column7: No way. Her old man is rich. He buys her anything she wants.
column8: Lucky her. Anyway, I think that is just as beautiful.
column9: I think you've lost it.
column10: Well, that's my opinion.
column11: I admit that she is much prettier than Kate.
column12: Oh, there is no comparison. Now we are talking but ugly.
column13: At least we agree on that. Let's go and get a drink.

column1: How is night life in Beijing?
column2: Very interesting!
column3: What do you suggest then?
column4: How about going to dance? There is a very good nightclub nearby.
column5: That's a great idea. Let's go... Oh, the dance hall looks very nice and the music is wonderful.
column6: I'm glad you like it.The band is called " Four and One ". They are especially good at playing rock and roll.
column7: That's great! I love to dance to fast music.
column8: Then you must be interested in disco dancing, aren't you?
column9: Yes, disco dancing is my favorite.It' s great fun and good exercise as well.
column10: OK. Let's disco.
column11: Now the band is playing a slow dance.
column12: That's a waltz. Would you like to try it?
column13: Sorry, I think I'Il sit out the next dance.
column14: All right. Let me get you something to drink.

column1: I'm so sorry about your brother, Mr. Wang.
column2: Thanks, Jane.
column3: If you need any help, just let me know.

column1: Can I help you?
column2: Is this the right subway to the Wall Street?
column3: Yes, it is.
column4: Could you tell me shall I take the express or local train?
column5: Sure. The local train. It stops at every station.
column6: Which of them is the local train, please?
column7: You take the D train on the downtown platform, and go three stops.
column8: How much is the fare?
column9: One dollar and twenty cents. You give me the money and I ’ ll exchange it for a token.
column10: What should I do with the token?
column11: You put it in the slot at the turnstile and then push the turnstile to get into the platform.

column1: What can I help you with?
column2: May I ask you something?
column3: What's your question?
column4: How many hours behind the wheel do I need?
column5: What do you need to take it for?
column6: I'm trying to get my license.
column7: You need six hours.
column8: Can I do all six hours in one day?
column9: You have to do it in three days.
column10: That's all I have to do?
column11: That's everything.
column12: Well, that's a relief.

column1: I miss grandma. I dreamed about her yesterday.
column2: Dear, let ’ s drop the subject.

column1: May I have a reservation?
column2: Yes, of course.
column3: I've got three guests today. We'd like a table next to the window.
column4: All right. Your name, please.
column5: I'm Chen Liang.
column6: Chen Liang, a table for four. And when are you coming?
column7: We may come at 6:30 p. m.
column8: OK. We look forward to seeing you. Goodbye.
column9: Goodbye.

column1: I like to drive on freeway.
column2: Don't drive too fast.
column3: Don't worry.There' re few cars now.
column4: Be careful.It' s dangerous to drive fast.

column1: What's the bonus like at your company?
column2: Well, it's OK, I suppose. We get about the equivalent of six months' salary.
column3: Six months' salary? Are you serious? That's incredible!
column4: Maybe. But you'd be amazed at how little's left after the credit companies have deducted their share from my account.
column5: Hey, I know what that's like. I bought a BMW on my Visa card. Now the payments really hurt.
column6: Well, you're lucky that you're still able to make your payments. I missed a credit payment last month. Now my bank account's overdrawn, and the company is threatening to take back my purchases.
column7: What did you buy?
column8: A new home health monitor.
column9: Health Monitor? I read an article about that racket.They' re overpriced to begin with! Listen, if I were you, I'd let them take back their monitor and spend my money on something more practical.
column10: You're kidding!
column11: No joke!
column12: That's something else! Maybe I'll return it to them.

column1: Don't tell me you're pregnant again.
column2: I'm afraid so.

column1: What do you think of smoking?
column2: It ’ s harmful not only for yourself but for others.
column3: What in your opinion can be done to stop smoking?
column4: Stop producing cigarettes.
column5: But that ’ ll affect the national economy.
column6: That ’ s right. But I don ’ t think there are better ways.
column7: How about painting a warning on each cigarette packet?
column8: Maybe it can take effect.

column1: May I help you?
column2: Yes, can you tell me where I can find a travel agency?
column3: Take the right road and walk ten minutes. You will see the Star Travel Agency.
column4: Thank you.

column1: Excuse me, I'm looking for your casual short-sleeved shirts. Can you tell me where those are?
column2: Right over here, sir. What-size do you wear?
column3: Medium.
column4: These here are all mediums.
column5: Thank you. I think I'll take this one, and these pants as well. They're presents for a friend.
column6: Shall I gift-wrap them for you, sir?
column7: Yes, please.

column1: Forest Restaurant. What can I do for you?
column2: May I make a reservation?
column3: Of course. At what time?
column4: The four of us will be there at 7:00 this evening.
column5: OK, sir. We are looking forward to your arrival.

column1: Here is your spicy diced chicken with peanuts, sir.
column2: Thank you. It looks very attractive.
column3: I would advise you to enjoy the dish while it is hot.
column4: Tasty and tender! It must be one of the famous local dishes.
column5: Yes. It's a traditional dish.
column6: And it must be very particular in cooking.
column7: You are right, sir. To prepare it, a Sichuan food chef first fries some chilli until they turn reddish brown, and then puts diced chicken breast meat into the pot with other condiments and peanuts. That's why the dish has a bright colour.
column8: I see.
column9: Enjoy yourself, sir.

column1: OK. I'll take your bet, as long as the winner gets to pick the movie. What about you, Nick?
column2: Sure. Do you want to go first, Sally?
column3: Why not! I rolled a five. The category is Best Pictures.
column4: OK, here's your question What movie won the 1996 Oscar for Best Picture?
column5: I know that, it's The English Patient. It was one of the only good American movies of the 90s.
column6: Well, along with Jurassic Park! Nice going, you got the right answer.

column1: Excuse me. Are these chips on sale?
column2: Yes. You will save 90 cents on each bag.
column3: Is there any limit?
column4: No, no limit. You can take as many as you want.
column5: That ’ s good. Thanks.
column6: You ’ re welcome.

column1: There are lots of new teachers in our class this semester.
column2: Yeah, so what do you think about the teachers?
column3: To be honest, I like all of them, except for the math teacher. Though he must be quite young, he seems like an old person. He's so boring.
column4: I think so too. I don't like him either. Well, who do you like best?
column5: It might be the English teacher. What about you?
column6: Me, too. She speaks very clearly and doesn't use very complicated words so that it is easy for us to understand her.
column7: She is a pretty good teacher! With her help I think I can make great progress in English.
column8: Yeah, I like her way of teaching. She told us not to cram for exams, and to pay more attention to communicating than memorizing.
column9: I think it's a good way to develop our language ability.
column10: Actually, our new math teacher is a good person. He just can't find an appropriate way to teach us.

column1: Excuse me, Miss. I feel like vomiting. Can I bother you for some ice water, please?
column2: Sure, sir. But can I suggest a cup of warm water instead, I think it may help settle your stomach down.
column3: Fine, please.
column4: You can find an airsick bag in the seat pocket in front of you.
column5: Thank you very much for your kindness.
column6: You are welcome. I'll be back with the warm water in a minute.

column1: I want to change rooms. In fact, I want a refund for tonight!
column2: If you tell me the exact problem, I can be more helpful.
column3: Cockroaches have declared war on my room!
column4: Allow me to apologize. I'll give you another room right now, and a full refund for tonight.
column5: Thank you for not asking me to collect the roaches in a jar as evidence.
column6: Sir, only your mother wants to please you more than we do.

column1: We finally get a chance to meet ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: It's no problem.
column4: I need to speak with you about your daughter.
column5: Is there something wrong?
column6: I enjoy having your daughter in my class.
column7: I'm glad to hear it.
column8: She is a great addition to my class.
column9: You don't have anything bad to say about her?
column10: She is always behaving herself, and she's so smart.

column1: Excuse me. Where is the way out?
column2: Well, that's what I'm looking for myself.
column3: It's very confusing in here, isn't it?
column4: Absolutely. Oh, do you see a sign there?
column5: It should be the way out.
column6: OK. Let's go and see.

column1: This is great, isn't it?
column2: It's the most fun I've had in years.
column3: We should do this more often.
column4: Yes, we should.

column1: What would you like to do tonight?
column2: I'm not sure.
column3: What about going to a movie?
column4: OK, let's go to the cinema to see what's on.

column1: Have you got any better?
column2: That's the best there is.
column3: Okay, I'll take one.
column4: That'll be $ 200, sir.

column1: Good afternoon.can I be of any assistance to you?
column2: Yes, I am looking for a suit.
column3: Here are the suits. Which one would you like?
column4: Can I have a black one over there?
